summary: This is a brief email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to a court, attaching a copy of a plea agreement in the Jeffrey Epstein case and notifying the court of a scheduling conflict for the upcoming plea acceptance proceeding.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The author of the correspondence, who is attaching the plea agreement and informing the court about scheduling for the plea acceptance proceeding.

events.title: Rescheduled Plea Acceptance Proceeding
events.description: A court proceeding scheduled for 9:00 a.m. to accept a plea agreement in the Jeffrey Epstein case.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: A plea agreement in the Jeffrey Epstein case was finalized and attached to this correspondence.
A plea acceptance proceeding was scheduled for July 31, 2008, at 9:00 a.m.
The communication indicates coordination between the U.S. Attorney's office and the court regarding the scheduling of this significant legal event.
